main event: Multiple sightings of round, unidentified flying objects in Batesville, Mississippi on July 17, 1952, including observations by Lt Colonel Walter J. Winfield and Captain J. Wm. Lyons.
interesting points: The objects were observed to make abrupt changes in direction and had a vertical back and forth movement.
One of the objects was observed to be circular and at an altitude of 11,000 feet.
The weather at the time of the sighting included overcast at 20,000 feet and broken clouds at 30,000 to 32,000 feet.
The objects were approximately 100 feet in diameter and traveled at speeds between 3 to 500 mph.

There were witnesses from the Mississippi State Highway Patrol, and the Memphis Air Route Traffic Control Center reported no relationship between the sightings and the aircraft operating in the area at the time.
witnesses: Lt Colonel Walter J. Winfield, Captain J. Wm. Lyons, J. D. Watts, J. E. Cunliffe of the Mississippi State Highway Patrol
